pageContext.claim: “Think of what we did with our military. Think of the numbers that we have for our military. We have numbers -- nobody's ever heard of these numbers before.”
pageContext.analysis: The fiscal year 2019 spending bill provides $617 billion for the base budget and another $69 billion for war funding, or $686 billion. It does not even provide record funding to the U.S. military in raw dollars: Obama had $710 billion in 2011 and $714 billion in 2010. A better way to measure over time is as a percentage of the economy, and Trump’s is only one-third the size of the defense budget at the height of the Vietnam War.
